attributes.action: Financial Aid for any students who can't take part in online learning.
attributes.additional_details: Hundreds of thousands of students are being deprived of their education because they can't access the online classes or resources which are available. They have an equal right to education just like all other students in the UK and financial aid would help them get the education they deserve.
attributes.background: Government should provide financial aid for students who can't participate in online learning due to lack of technology or connection to the internet.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about students not being able to access online learning, however it's not clear whether you want this support to be provided to primary and secondary school students, or university students, or both.

You might like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569205
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326636
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563639
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557421

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
